alert.note: Alert for Stark (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 7:05AM EST until March 11 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following county, Stark. * WHEN...Until 1215 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 702 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Canton, North Canton, Louisville, East Canton and Meyers Lake. The West Branch Nimishillen Creek is in flood in sections within the warning, particularly in North Canton. The East Branch Nimishillen Creek at Louisville is also approaching flood stage. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
